meanings.definition: Relating to or based on operations or practical considerations.
meanings.sent1: The operationalistic approach to problem-solving focuses on practical solutions.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated his operationalistic mindset when it came to organizing the project.
meanings.sent3: The operationalistic decision to use paper plates at the picnic saved time on washing dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her operationalistic thinking was like a well-oiled machine, always efficient and effective.
meanings.sent5: The operationalistic nature of the plan made it easy to implement and see results quickly.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a focus on practicality or efficiency.
meanings.sent1: The team's operationalistic approach ensured they completed the task ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: His operationalistic nature made him the perfect candidate for the job.
meanings.sent3: The operationalistic choice to carpool to work saved both time and money.
meanings.sent4: The operationalistic design of the new software streamlined the entire process.
meanings.sent5: Her operationalistic mindset was a valuable asset in the fast-paced environment.
